record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, JULY 23, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, JULY 23, 2007 -- (Senate - July 20, 2007)

[Page: S9668]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Monday, July 23; that on Monday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then proceed to the consideration of S. 1642, with the other provisions of the previous order remaining in effect.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
